summary: Medicare covers “durable” medical devices, but disposable devices—which are used one time—are generally not covered. Since 2017, Medicare has covered disposable negative pressure wound therapy devices that home health agencies provide to homebound beneficiaries. The devices apply airtight pressure to cover wounds, such as diabetic ulcers, and suction away fluid to promote healing. We found that Medicare paid home health agencies about $735,000 for these...
title: Medicare: Spending on Certain Disposable Wound Care Devices in Home Health
